revised_title: Effects of Temperature and Magnetization on the Permeability of Magnetically Shielded Iron
tldr: The author investigates the effects of temperature and magnetization on the magnetic permeability of magnetically shielded iron. The experiments reveal that increasing temperature and magnetization can increase the permeability, but the initial permeability decreases after mechanical disturbance. The study also compares the hysteresis loops of the iron alloy to a normal specimen.
